Subjective: Left ear pain and fullness; feels like water inside. Onset 2-3 days ago, gradually worsening. Associated decreased hearing in Left ear. Pain is manageable, rated 3-4/10, but increases to 6-7/10 after showering. Aggravated by swimming. Unable to exercise/swim due to pain. No fever, feels generally well. Social: New swimmer for a few weeks. Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. No painkillers taken. Request: Wants ear examined to find cause; wants pain relief. Concern: Worried about hearing loss and ear health.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right Ear: External canal clear, tympanic membrane normal. Left Ear: Pain on pinna pull. External auditory canal is red, swollen, inflamed, and thick. Tympanic membrane not well visualized.
Assessment: Left Otitis Externa (Inflammation of the ear canal). Suspected cause from moisture (swimming) and mechanical irritation (cotton buds).
Plan: Paracetamol up to 4000mg per day as needed for pain.
Prescribed acidic, anti-inflammatory ear drops, use three times a day for one week in Left ear.
Advice: Keep Left ear dry for the next week. Stop cleaning ears with cotton buds.
Follow-up: Return for consultation in one week for re-evaluation.
